result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhoneil A Elliott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge by 7/11/23.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges by 7/11/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rhoneil A Elliott

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rhoneil A Elliott in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Rhoneil A Elliott in custody.  
Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 5 DAYS concurrent in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served.

- Submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge by 7/11/23.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay ALL costs, fees and surcharges by 7/11/23. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Rhoneil A Elliott not in court, in custody.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Defendant is being revoked but has not found out for how long.  Atty. Toran requests a plea and sentencing date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Attorney James Edgar Toran in court, defendant Rhoneil A Elliott not in court, in custody.  
Brandon Schwebler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
OFF THE RECORD.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Defendant has a revocation hearing on 6/07/22 and Atty. Toran would like to see the results of that hearing and requests a status date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Rhoneil A Elliott in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Defendant Rhoneil A Elliott in custody.  Patricia Irene Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rhoneil A Elliott appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Payable Number: 1005613,

Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/11/2022@2:30pm
